frontmatter.title: Decomposition of a monad into adjoint functors

mainmatter.p: A monad on a category \mathcal { C } is a functor M : \mathcal { C } \to \mathcal { C } equipped with natural transformations \eta : \operatorname {Id} \to M and \mu : M \circ M \to M satisfying identity and associativity laws. In an unbiased way, we have a family of natural transformations M^n \to M with associativity.
In short, it is a monoid in the category of endofunctors equipped with composition as the monoidal product.
